intro: Hypopitys multiflora var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth hypopitys, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of China. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its morphology includes a short, woody stem and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
